solution_line_template: Since there are {num_types} types of chocolate bars and each type has {bars_per_type} bars, the total number of chocolate bars is {bars_per_type}*{num_types}=<<{bars_per_type}*{num_types}={total_bars}>>{total_bars}.
Since there is a total of {total_bars} chocolate bars and {num_types} types of chocolate, we divide {total_bars}/{num_types}=<<{total_bars}/{num_types}={percentage_per_type}>>{percentage_per_type}%.
